title: The Best Haircut Trends From Paris Fashion Week Street Style
description: With Paris Fashion Week in full swing, the best place to find fresh haircut inspiration isn’t just backstage — it’s also among the many stylish guests who descend on the city’s streets ahead of the shows.Paris has mastered a handful of signature cuts — think French bobs, effortlessly perfect fringes, and long, layered styles. This season is no exception. Alongside these timeless looks, we’ve spotted XL braids, pixie cuts, and sharp lobs making a statement.Without further ado, here are 12 of the best haircut trends from Paris Fashion Week so far.All linked products are independently selected by our editors. If you purchase any of these products, we may earn a commission.The pixie cut is back with a bang. We love this close-cropped style, complete with a choppy micro fringe. Photo: Christian Vierig/Getty Images.Meet the "snack-size" bob — a sleek, jaw-skimming cut that looks especially chic with a center part.Photo: Christian Vierig/Getty Images.The deep side part and oval layers make this cut — spotted on a guest outside the Marie Adam-Leenaerdt fashion show — utterly chic. Photo: Raimonda Kulikauskiene/Getty Images.This long style, with fragmented full bangs, channels Anne Hathaway in The Devil Wears Prada.Photographed by Christian Vierig/Getty ImagesThis beautiful cut proves that layers and curls are a perfect pair. Photo: Raimonda Kulikauskiene/Getty Images.The slicked-back bun has had its moment; now, the sleek braid takes center stage.Photo: Christian Vierig/Getty Images.We love this grown-out wolf cut, featuring curtain bangs and textured layers through the mid-lengths.Photo: Raimonda Kulikauskiene/Getty Images.Natural hairstyles are reigning at Paris Fashion Week, and these subtle layers elevate this guest’s gorgeous curls.Photo: Christian Vierig/Getty Images.Here’s proof that the medium-length cut is anything but mediocre. Choppy ends, like this guest’s look outside the Ganni show, add extra movement.Photo: by Christian Vierig/Getty Images.Various protective styles, including these beautiful XL braids, have been spotted both on and off the runways throughout fashion month.Photo: Raimonda Kulikauskiene/Getty Images.If your hair is all one length, try C-shape layers like this guest outside the Magda Butrym show. They’ll add dimension and movement.Photo: Ussin Yala/Getty Images.Long layered lengths are taking Paris by storm. This swishy cut is made even more stunning by the mocha mousse hair color.Photo: Ussin Yala/Getty Images.Like what you see? How about some more R29 goodness, right here?I Got The Kicked Bob & Found My Own Personal StyleThe Best Haircut Trends From London Fashion WeekThe Best Haircuts From NYFW Street Style
author: Jacqueline Kilikita
